feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The student clearly built and tested a functioning financial application for CPG acquisition screening (webhook/API intake, scoring dimensions, composite score and recommendation) and produced concrete outputs (example deal with Total deal score 87). Implementation and reflection statements show the tool was constructed, executed, and evaluated, meeting the criterion for a working financial app.
- Integrate AI: The student demonstrates concrete, multi-part AI integration (model selection, prompt templates, automated scoring, and end-to-end workflow outputs) and shows that AI materially adds value to the tool. While they acknowledge some errors and surface-level outputs, the implementation is substantive and aligned with Discover–Implement–Reflect stages, meeting the PASS standard.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "I wanted to create a financial tool that would actually be useful in my time as um working in finance."

"I constructed this from um the help of AI through like chat GPT." / "and Google Gemini um using the driver framework to kind of streamline my process a little bit better and formulate my ideas more clearly um for this."
"Total deal score 87. So that's um on a scale of 0 to 100 um meaning that it is probably a good investment to take."
criteria.driver_alignment:
- Discover: identified a real finance use-case (CPG M&A screening) motivating the tool.
- Implement: described building workflows, webhook/API, JSON inputs, scoring logic, and using AI prompts to generate analyses and composite scores.
- Reflect: noted practical value and limitations, indicating testing and iterative improvement.
criteria.reasoning: The student clearly built and tested a functioning financial application for CPG acquisition screening (webhook/API intake, scoring dimensions, composite score and recommendation) and produced concrete outputs (example deal with Total deal score 87). Implementation and reflection statements show the tool was constructed, executed, and evaluated, meeting the criterion for a working financial app.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "I constructed this from um the help of AI through like chat GPT."
"So for all of these I used the chat um GPT40 model for market attractiveness, margin quality, scalability, brand mode, integration, risk and then for each dimension provide a score 0 through five."
"I think that this created a lot of value for um, specifically the field that I'm going into and is a tool that I can definitely use in the workforce."
criteria.driver_alignment:
Discover: identified a real-world finance/M&A need to automate brand screening and acquisition analysis.  
Implement: used AI (ChatGPT/Gemini/OpenAI API) to build webhooks, prompt templates, scoring logic, and automated evaluation nodes.  
Reflect: assessed value and limitations of the AI-enabled tool for practical use and noted areas for improvement.
criteria.reasoning: The student demonstrates concrete, multi-part AI integration (model selection, prompt templates, automated scoring, and end-to-end workflow outputs) and shows that AI materially adds value to the tool. While they acknowledge some errors and surface-level outputs, the implementation is substantive and aligned with Discover–Implement–Reflect stages, meeting the PASS standard.
